title: Include
description: Include content from an external source (e.g. file, URL).

type.$comment:
This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.
It is extended with the titles of all descendant types during
the generation of schema.json files.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

executionAuto.description: Under which circumstances the code should be automatically executed.

compileDigest.description: A digest of the content, semantics and dependencies of the node.

executeDigest.description: The `compileDigest` of the node when it was last executed.

executionDependencies.description: The upstream dependencies of this node.

executionDependents.description: The downstream dependents of this node.

executionTags.description: Tags in the code which affect its execution

executionCount.description: A count of the number of times that the node has been executed.
executionCount.$comment:
Intended to increment with each successive execution of the node, including across sessions.
Note that this differs to the `execution_count` in Jupyter Notebook format which is
the "code cell's prompt number" and which resets at the start of each new session.

executionRequired.description: Whether, and why, the code requires execution or re-execution.

executionKernel.description: The id of the kernel that the node was last executed in.

executionStatus.description: Status of the most recent, including any current, execution.

executionEnded.description: The timestamp when the last execution ended.

errors.description: Errors when compiling (e.g. syntax errors) or executing the node.

source.description: The external source of the content, a file path or URL.

mediaType.description: Media type of the source content.
mediaType.$comment:
Typically expressed using a file name extensions (e.g. `md`) or a
MIME type (e.g. `text/md`).

select.description: A query to select a subset of content from the source

content.description: The structured content decoded from the source.
content.$comment:
Assumes that included content will be block content i.e. that there will be limited
instances where a user would want to use an `Include` node to transclude inline content.
